title: Will the popularity of baseball influence geopolitical relations between the US and Japan by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there are documented instances where the popularity of baseball has directly influenced geopolitical relations between the United States and Japan. Influence on geopolitical relations must be evidenced by:

- Official statements from the governments of the United States or Japan attributing changes in diplomatic, economic, or military policies or agreements directly to the popularity of baseball.
- Publicly available analysis from at least three reputable international relations or geopolitical analysis organizations (e.g., Council on Foreign Relations, International Crisis Group, Chatham House) confirming the direct influence of baseball's popularity on specific policy changes or diplomatic initiatives between the two countries.

Instances where baseball's popularity indirectly influences cultural exchange or general goodwill, without direct policy or diplomatic impact, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Ukraine join NATO before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Ukraine becomes a full member of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO). Full membership is defined as the completion of all formal accession processes and the receipt of an official invitation to join NATO, followed by the ratification of its membership by all current NATO member states. The resolution will be based on official announcements from NATO or the government of Ukraine. In the absence of such announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. This question resolves as NO if Ukraine has not become a full member by the specified date, or if NATO ceases to exist as an organization before Ukraine's accession.

title: Will a Formula 1 Grand Prix be hosted in a country currently under international sanctions by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a Formula 1 Grand Prix is officially announced and scheduled to take place in a country that, at the time of the announcement, is under international sanctions imposed by either the United Nations, the European Union, the United States, or a combination thereof. The sanctions must be related to either economic measures, trade restrictions, or other forms of diplomatic and financial penalties. The Grand Prix must be part of the official Formula 1 World Championship calendar, as confirmed by the Fédération Internationale de l'Automobile (FIA) or Formula 1 management. In the event of a cancellation after the announcement, the question will still resolve as Yes if the cancellation is due to reasons unrelated to the lifting of sanctions. In the case of sanctions being lifted after the announcement but before the event, the question will still resolve as Yes.

title: Will a new infectious disease prompt the development of nuclear biocontainment technologies before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a new infectious disease prompts the development and official announcement of nuclear biocontainment technologies. Nuclear biocontainment technologies refer to the use of nuclear energy or radiation to contain, eliminate, or manage infectious diseases, either through sterilization processes, mutation prevention, or other innovative methods directly involving nuclear technology. The development must be confirmed by an official announcement from a recognized health organization (e.g., World Health Organization, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) or a reputable scientific institution. In the absence of an official announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient. The technology must be beyond the conceptual phase, with either a prototype demonstrated or implementation plans officially announced. In the event of multiple developments, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first confirmed case.

title: Will the US Senate pass significant legislation regarding nuclear safety standards by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the US Senate has passed legislation that significantly amends or introduces new nuclear safety standards. Significant legislation is defined as a bill that introduces new regulations, enhances existing safety protocols, or provides substantial funding towards nuclear safety improvements. The legislation must be passed by the US Senate and not solely introduced or proposed.

For the purpose of this question, "significant" refers to legislation that has a broad impact on nuclear safety practices, regulatory oversight, or emergency preparedness across multiple nuclear facilities in the United States. The passage of the legislation must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

In the event that multiple pieces of legislation are passed, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets the criteria outlined above. Temporary measures or executive orders do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the European Union implement a unified nuclear waste management policy by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the European Union has officially implemented a unified nuclear waste management policy that applies to all member states. The policy must be comprehensive, addressing the storage, transportation, and disposal of nuclear waste. It must be ratified by the European Parliament and the Council of the European Union, and be in effect across all EU member states. In the absence of an official announcement, confirmation from at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence of implementation. The policy must be operational, not merely proposed or in a planning stage. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., only applying to certain types of nuclear waste or only in effect in some member states), the question will resolve as No unless there is a clear timeline and commitment for a full implementation by the resolution date.

title: Will the integration of information technology in education significantly reduce the global digital divide by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a significant reduction in the global digital divide as a result of the integration of information technology in education. Significant reduction is defined as:
- At least a 50% decrease in the number of individuals worldwide without access to the internet and digital learning resources.
- A measurable improvement in digital literacy rates across both developed and developing countries, as reported by the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) or a similar authoritative body.

The integration of information technology in education includes, but is not limited to, the provision of digital devices, internet access, digital literacy programs, and online learning platforms.

In the absence of direct data from UNESCO or similar bodies, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient.

This question resolves as YES upon confirmation of the above criteria by the specified date. Otherwise, this question resolves as NO.

title: Will the FIFA World Cup's expansion to 48 teams lead to a significant increase in global soccer viewership by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a significant increase in global soccer viewership attributed to the FIFA World Cup's expansion to 48 teams. A 'significant increase' is defined as a 20% rise in average global viewership numbers for FIFA World Cup events, compared to the average viewership of the three World Cups held prior to the expansion. Viewership numbers must be verified by FIFA's official reports or, in their absence, by credible sports analytics firms. Increases in viewership due to factors other than the expansion (e.g., changes in broadcasting technology, global population growth) must be demonstrably excluded from consideration. In the event that FIFA does not release viewership data, or if the data is inconclusive, the resolution will rely on reports from at least three reputable sports news organizations (e.g., ESPN, BBC Sport, Sky Sports).

title: Will South Korea become the leader in global digital governance by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, South Korea is recognized as the global leader in digital governance. Recognition must come from at least one of the following authoritative sources: - The United Nations E-Government Survey. - The World Bank's Digital Government Development Index. - A consensus among at least three major technology-focused publications (e.g., Wired, TechCrunch, MIT Technology Review). Leadership in digital governance is defined by pioneering innovative digital services, policies that promote digital inclusivity and accessibility, and the implementation of cutting-edge technology in public administration. The question will resolve as No if South Korea does not meet these criteria by the specified date. In the event of a tie or close competition with another country, the question will resolve as Yes only if South Korea is clearly distinguished as the leader by the majority of the aforementioned sources.

title: Will Microsoft's carbon negative pledge significantly impact global CO2 levels by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Microsoft's carbon negative pledge has led to a measurable and significant reduction in global CO2 levels. A 'significant reduction' is defined as a decrease in global CO2 levels by at least 0.1% from 2020 levels, as reported by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) or a similar authoritative body. The reduction must be directly attributable to Microsoft's initiatives, as evidenced by a comprehensive study or report from a reputable scientific or environmental organization. In the absence of direct attribution, a consensus among at least three major environmental science publications (e.g., Nature Climate Change, Science Advances, Environmental Science & Technology) that Microsoft's actions have contributed substantially to the reduction will also result in a Yes resolution. In case of conflicting reports or lack of clear evidence, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a breakthrough in physics lead to a new form of clean energy by 2040?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2040, a breakthrough in physics leads to the development of a new form of clean energy that is:

- Scientifically validated through peer-reviewed research.
- Demonstrated to be viable for large-scale energy production, with efficiency and sustainability metrics surpassing current leading clean energy sources (e.g., solar, wind, hydroelectric).

A "breakthrough in physics" refers to a fundamental discovery or innovation in the field of physics that enables the development or significant enhancement of energy sources, not previously feasible or efficient.

The development must be confirmed by the publication of research in a peer-reviewed scientific journal and recognized by a reputable scientific organization or a consensus in the scientific community.

In the absence of direct scientific consensus, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) will be considered sufficient evidence.

Developments that are purely theoretical, without practical demonstration or viability for large-scale application, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the World Health Organization declare a global health emergency due to climate-related diseases by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the World Health Organization (WHO) has officially declared a global health emergency specifically due to an increase in diseases directly attributed to climate change. Such diseases may include, but are not limited to, vector-borne diseases, water-borne diseases, food-borne diseases, and respiratory conditions exacerbated by climate-related factors.

The declaration must be made public through an official WHO announcement or press release. In the absence of a direct announcement, confirmation from at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient.

This question will resolve as No if no such declaration has been made by the specified date. In the event of a declaration related to a combination of factors where climate change is not the primary cause, the question will resolve as No unless the WHO explicitly cites climate change as a direct and primary cause of the health emergency.

title: Will India become a global leader in quantum computing by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, India is recognized as a global leader in the field of quantum computing. Recognition as a global leader requires:
- India hosting at least one quantum computer that ranks among the top 5 in the world for computational power, as reported by a reputable technology or scientific publication (e.g., Nature, Science, IEEE Spectrum).
- Indian-based researchers or institutions publishing at least 10 significant (cited more than 100 times each) peer-reviewed research papers on quantum computing in leading scientific journals or conferences.
- India successfully commercializing quantum computing technologies, with at least one Indian company being recognized among the top 5 globally in terms of market share or technological innovation in quantum computing.

Recognition must come from authoritative sources in the field of quantum computing, including major scientific publications, international technology assessment organizations, or consensus among recognized experts in the field.

In the absence of clear global leadership, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major breakthrough in COVID-19 vaccine development be achieved through the use of artificial intelligence by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major breakthrough in COVID-19 vaccine development is achieved through the significant use of artificial intelligence (AI). A "major breakthrough" is defined as the development of a vaccine that demonstrates at least a 90% efficacy rate in preventing COVID-19 in phase 3 clinical trials, as reported by a regulatory body such as the FDA, EMA, or WHO. The use of AI must be integral to the discovery, design, or optimization of the vaccine, and must be documented in the official announcement of the breakthrough or in peer-reviewed scientific literature. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient to confirm the breakthrough. The vaccine must be approved for general or emergency use by a major health regulatory body by the resolution date. In the event of multiple vaccines meeting these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one of them is attributed to AI's significant contribution.

title: Will Australia launch its own sovereign satellite navigation system by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Australia has officially launched its own sovereign satellite navigation system. The system must be fully operational and capable of providing independent satellite navigation services to Australia, without relying on existing systems such as GPS (United States), GLONASS (Russia), Galileo (European Union), or BeiDou (China). The launch of such a system must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The system must be designed for civilian and/or military use and provide coverage across Australia's territory. In the event of a partial deployment (e.g., limited to specific regions or for specific applications), the question will resolve as Yes if the system is intended for nationwide coverage and use.

title: Will the integration of cricket analytics technology significantly influence team strategies in major leagues by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the integration of cricket analytics technology has been widely adopted and significantly influences team strategies in major cricket leagues (e.g., Indian Premier League, Big Bash League, Caribbean Premier League). Significant influence is defined as changes in team selection, batting order, bowling strategies, or field placements that are directly attributed to insights gained from cricket analytics technology. Adoption and influence must be confirmed by official statements from at least three major cricket leagues or teams, or reported by reputable sports news organizations (ESPN, Cricinfo, The Guardian, BBC Sport). In the absence of official statements, credible reports from at least three reputable sports news organizations are sufficient. The technology must be used consistently throughout a season, not just in isolated matches. Temporary or experimental use does not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will machine learning algorithms surpass human accuracy in predicting consumer behavior by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, machine learning algorithms have been demonstrated to surpass human accuracy in predicting consumer behavior in at least one major industry sector (e.g., retail, finance, entertainment). The demonstration must be supported by a peer-reviewed study or a comprehensive report from a reputable analytics or research firm. The study or report must compare the performance of machine learning algorithms directly against human experts in the same tasks, using standardized metrics for accuracy. The findings must be recognized and validated by at least one leading industry association or academic institution. In the event of conflicting reports or studies, the question will resolve based on the consensus of findings from the most reputable sources. Machine learning algorithms are defined as systems that use data-driven techniques to make predictions or decisions without being explicitly programmed for the specific task.

title: Will the Democratic Party (US) implement a policy to significantly boost technology startups by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Democratic Party in the United States has implemented a policy or a set of policies aimed at significantly boosting technology startups. Significant boost refers to policies that directly provide financial support, tax incentives, regulatory changes, or any other substantial assistance that could lead to a measurable increase in the number or success rate of technology startups. The policy must be enacted into law or officially adopted by a relevant governmental body. Confirmation must come from official government documentation or announcements. In the absence of direct government confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) will be considered sufficient. Temporary measures or proposals without enactment do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will North Korea undergo a major legal reform by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, North Korea has officially announced and implemented a major legal reform. A "major legal reform" is defined as a significant change in the legal system or constitution that affects the governance structure, human rights, or the legal rights of its citizens in a substantial way. The reform must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The reform must be implemented, not merely proposed or in a trial phase. Changes that affect only specific sectors or regions without nationwide impact do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a landmark legal case involving quantum mechanics principles emerge before 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a legal case emerges that is widely recognized as a landmark case involving the principles of quantum mechanics. A "landmark case" is defined as a case that sets a significant legal precedent, influences the development of law, or significantly affects the application of law in the field of quantum mechanics. The case must involve the application, interpretation, or challenge of quantum mechanics principles in a legal context.

The recognition of the case as a landmark must come from credible legal analysis or commentary from reputable legal institutions, law schools, or publications such as the American Bar Association, Harvard Law Review, or The Yale Law Journal. In the absence of such recognition, coverage by at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) will suffice.

In the event that multiple cases emerge, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one case meets the above criteria. Cases that are purely theoretical or hypothetical without actual legal proceedings do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a significant international climate change treaty be ratified by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant international climate change treaty is ratified. A "significant" treaty is defined as one that includes commitments from at least 75% of the world's nations and aims to reduce global greenhouse gas emissions by at least 30% below 1990 levels by 2050. The treaty must be ratified by the participating countries' governments or relevant governing bodies. Ratification is confirmed through official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of direct announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence of ratification. The treaty must be new or an extension with significant amendments to previous treaties, not merely a reaffirmation of past commitments. In the event of multiple treaties, the question resolves as Yes if at least one meets these criteria.

title: Will Amazon's market share in the global e-commerce sector exceed 50% by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Amazon's market share in the global e-commerce sector exceeds 50%. The market share will be determined based on the total retail value of goods sold through Amazon's e-commerce platforms, including its main website and any subsidiaries, as a percentage of the total global e-commerce retail value. The assessment will rely on data reported by reputable market research firms such as Statista, eMarketer, or similar. In the absence of a single authoritative source, a consensus of reports from at least three reputable market research firms will be used to determine Amazon's market share. The resolution will consider only officially published data; estimates or forecasts published after December 31, 2025, will not be considered. In the event of conflicting data from different sources, the average of the three most reputable sources will be used to determine the final market share.

title: Will the United States lead the world in quantum computing technology development by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the United States is recognized as the global leader in the development of quantum computing technology. Leadership will be determined based on the following criteria:

- Number of quantum bits (qubits) successfully integrated and maintained in a stable state in a single system.
- Breakthroughs in quantum computing algorithms or error correction methods that are widely recognized by the scientific community.
- The establishment or operation of quantum computing facilities that are among the largest or most advanced globally.
- Significant contributions to the global quantum computing community, such as hosting major conferences, leading international collaborations, or publishing influential research in peer-reviewed journals.

Leadership must be confirmed by a consensus among reputable technology news outlets (e.g., Wired, MIT Technology Review), government reports, or publications in top-tier scientific journals. In the event of a dispute, the consensus opinion of recognized experts in the field will be the deciding factor.

title: Will a major breakthrough in biology lead to a significant shift in social sciences research methodologies by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major breakthrough in biology leads to a significant shift in social sciences research methodologies. A "major breakthrough in biology" refers to a discovery or development that fundamentally changes the understanding or application of biological concepts in a way that is widely recognized by the scientific community. A "significant shift in social sciences research methodologies" refers to a change in the approach, techniques, or tools used in social sciences research that is adopted by a substantial portion of the research community. This shift must be directly attributable to the biological breakthrough and must be documented in peer-reviewed social sciences journals or recognized by leading social sciences institutions or bodies. In the absence of direct documentation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or endorsements by recognized academic figures in the field are sufficient. The breakthrough and its impact on social sciences must be clearly defined and recognized within the specified timeframe.

title: Will advancements in microbiology influence global health policies more than technology by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, advancements in microbiology have had a more significant influence on global health policies than technological advancements. Influence on global health policies is defined as the adoption of new or revised policies, guidelines, or recommendations by at least three of the following organizations: World Health Organization (WHO), Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC), and Public Health England (PHE), that are directly attributed to microbiological research findings. The influence is measured by the number of new or revised policies, the scope of these policies (global vs. regional), and their impact on public health practices. Technological advancements include, but are not limited to, developments in medical devices, health information technologies, and biotechnologies. The comparison between the influences of microbiology and technology will be assessed based on reports and analyses from reputable health policy research organizations, such as the Health Policy Institute, the Commonwealth Fund, and the Kaiser Family Foundation. In the event of a tie or indeterminate influence, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the widespread adoption of COVID-19 vaccines lead to a permanent change in workplace dynamics by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a permanent change in workplace dynamics due to the widespread adoption of COVID-19 vaccines, as evidenced by:

- A significant increase (over 20%) in the number of people working remotely or in hybrid models compared to pre-pandemic levels (2019).
- Legislative changes or widespread corporate policies implemented in at least 50% of Fortune 500 companies that permanently alter work arrangements (e.g., flexible working hours, remote work options).
- Authoritative surveys or studies showing a lasting shift in employee preferences towards remote or hybrid work models, with at least a 20% increase in preference compared to 2019.

Permanent changes must be confirmed by reputable sources such as government labor departments, major business news outlets (e.g., Forbes, Bloomberg), or peer-reviewed academic publications. Temporary measures or trends that revert to pre-pandemic norms by the resolution date do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the discovery of dark matter lead to new economic industries by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the discovery of dark matter has directly led to the establishment of new economic industries. These industries must be recognized as directly resulting from the application, technology, or knowledge derived from dark matter research. The establishment of such industries must be confirmed by:
- Official announcements from companies or governments indicating the creation of new sectors or industries based on dark matter research.
- Coverage in at least three reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the economic impact of dark matter discovery.
- Publications in peer-reviewed scientific or economic journals that analyze the emergence of these industries.
In the absence of direct evidence, expert consensus within the scientific or economic communities indicating the establishment of new industries due to dark matter discovery will also be considered. This question does not resolve based on speculative or potential industries but requires concrete evidence of establishment and operation.

title: Will a major breakthrough in pharmacology create a billion-dollar industry by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major breakthrough in pharmacology leads to the creation of a new industry or significantly transforms an existing one, resulting in a market valuation of at least one billion US dollars. The breakthrough must be recognized as a significant advancement in the field of pharmacology, contributing to the development of new drugs, treatments, or therapeutic approaches with substantial impact on healthcare. The valuation must be confirmed by credible financial reports or analyses from reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Financial Times). In the event of multiple breakthroughs, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria. The breakthrough must be publicly acknowledged by at least three major pharmaceutical companies or healthcare institutions.

title: Will SpaceX's Starship enable the commercialization of space travel by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, SpaceX's Starship has successfully completed at least one commercial flight carrying paying passengers beyond Earth's atmosphere. Commercialization of space travel is defined as the offering and conducting of space travel services to paying customers for non-governmental purposes. The flight must be officially recognized by SpaceX and must have safely returned to Earth. Confirmation of the commercial flight can come from official SpaceX announcements, government space agencies, or credible news reports from major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). The service must be advertised and available to the public, not limited to private contracts or government-sponsored missions. In the event of a delay or cancellation of the Starship program, this question will resolve as No.

title: Will Japan implement a nationwide carbon neutrality policy by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Japan has officially implemented a nationwide policy aimed at achieving carbon neutrality. The policy must encompass significant measures across multiple sectors, including but not limited to energy, transportation, and industry, with the goal of reducing net carbon emissions to zero. The implementation of the policy must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., NHK, The Japan Times, Asahi Shimbun, Reuters, Bloomberg) are sufficient. The policy must be in active enforcement, not merely proposed or in planning stages. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific regions or sectors), the question will resolve as Yes if the policy is intended for nationwide application and significant steps have been taken towards this goal. Temporary measures or policies with a focus solely on carbon offsetting without direct emission reductions do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the global average temperature rise by more than 2 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the global average temperature has risen by more than 2 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels (defined as the average global temperature from 1850-1900). The assessment must be based on the annual average global surface temperature data as reported by the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) or the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC). In the event that neither organization provides a clear statement or report by the resolution date, reputable scientific journals or a consensus of climate scientists may be used to determine the outcome. This question resolves as NO if the increase is 2 degrees Celsius or less.

title: Will a major breakthrough in genetics lead to a significant increase in crop resilience to climate change by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major breakthrough in genetics leads to a significant increase in crop resilience to climate change. A "major breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or development that results in a measurable and widely recognized improvement in crop resilience against factors such as drought, temperature extremes, salinity, and pests. The improvement must be demonstrated through peer-reviewed research published in reputable scientific journals or officially recognized by a leading agricultural or scientific organization (e.g., FAO, IPCC, National Science Academies). The increase in resilience must be applicable to at least one major food crop (e.g., rice, wheat, maize) and must show potential for broad application in agricultural practices. In the event of multiple claims of breakthroughs, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one is widely accepted by the scientific community and has demonstrated practical application.

title: Will Microsoft engage in a significant geopolitical initiative by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Microsoft has officially announced or is actively participating in a significant geopolitical initiative. A "significant geopolitical initiative" is defined as any project or action that involves collaboration with one or more national governments, international organizations, or has a substantial impact on international relations or global policy. This may include, but is not limited to, initiatives related to cybersecurity, digital sovereignty, international data agreements, or efforts to combat global challenges such as climate change or cyber-terrorism.

The initiative must be confirmed through an official Microsoft announcement or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters). In the absence of an official announcement, the initiative must be verifiable through official government or international organization documents.

In the event of multiple initiatives, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets the above criteria. Temporary or minor engagements do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the MLB's international expansion efforts significantly influence geopolitical relations by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Major League Baseball's (MLB) international expansion efforts are recognized to have had a significant influence on geopolitical relations. Significant influence includes, but is not limited to, changes in diplomatic relationships, new trade agreements directly related to MLB activities, or substantial shifts in cultural diplomacy between the United States and at least one other nation due to MLB's expansion. The influence must be confirmed by official government statements from any of the involved countries or by credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of ambiguous or conflicting reports, a consensus among these sources will be required for resolution. Temporary or minor initiatives, such as one-off games or short-term cultural exchanges, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major golf tournament be used as a diplomatic tool in international relations by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major golf tournament (defined as one of the four major championships: The Masters, U.S. Open, The Open Championship, or the PGA Championship) is officially used as a platform for diplomatic engagement or negotiation between two or more countries. The use of the tournament as a diplomatic tool must be confirmed by an official statement from the governments involved or the organizing body of the tournament. In the absence of an official statement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) are sufficient. The engagement must be directly related to the tournament, such as hosting diplomatic meetings at the event, official participation of government representatives in tournament activities with the explicit purpose of diplomacy, or the announcement of diplomatic agreements during the tournament. Temporary or informal uses of the tournament for diplomatic purposes do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Russo-Ukrainian War lead to significant advancements in cybersecurity technologies by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, there are significant advancements in cybersecurity technologies attributed directly to the Russo-Ukrainian War. Significant advancements are defined as:
- The development and deployment of new cybersecurity technologies or methodologies that represent a substantial improvement over existing capabilities.
- The adoption of these technologies or methodologies by major governments, corporations, or cybersecurity organizations.
- Recognition of these advancements by reputable cybersecurity research institutions or in peer-reviewed cybersecurity journals.

For the purpose of this question, "significant advancements" must be clearly linked to the Russo-Ukrainian War, either as a response to cybersecurity challenges encountered during the conflict or as innovations inspired by it. The advancements must be documented and verified by credible sources, such as official government statements, reports from major cybersecurity firms, or coverage in reputable news outlets (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will a major technological breakthrough in artificial intelligence be influenced by philosophical theories by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major technological breakthrough in artificial intelligence (AI) is officially recognized as being significantly influenced by philosophical theories. A "major technological breakthrough" is defined as a development in AI that fundamentally changes the understanding, capabilities, or application of AI systems in a way that is recognized by a consensus of experts in the field. The influence of philosophical theories must be explicitly acknowledged in the breakthrough's foundational documents, such as white papers, research articles, or patent filings. The recognition of the breakthrough and its philosophical influence must be documented by at least one of the following: - Publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal. - Official announcement or documentation from a leading AI research institution. - Coverage by at least three reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian). In the event of multiple claims of influence, the question will resolve as Yes if the most significant breakthrough (as determined by its impact on the field) meets the above criteria. Temporary or speculative advancements do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will California introduce groundbreaking legislation on digital privacy by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, California has enacted legislation that significantly advances digital privacy protections beyond the status quo as of 2023. Groundbreaking legislation is defined as introducing new rights for individuals, substantial restrictions on data collection and use, or innovative enforcement mechanisms that are not present in existing laws. The legislation must be passed by the California State Legislature and signed into law by the Governor. Confirmation must come from official government announcements or documentation. In the absence of direct government confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Los Angeles Times, San Francisco Chronicle, The New York Times, The Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. Temporary executive orders or regulations that do not result in permanent legislative changes do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Democratic Party (US) secure a majority in both the House of Representatives and the Senate in the 2024 elections?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by January 1, 2025, the Democratic Party (US) has secured a majority of seats in both the House of Representatives and the Senate following the 2024 general elections. A majority in the House of Representatives is defined as holding more than half of the total seats available. A majority in the Senate is defined as holding more than half of the total seats, considering the Vice President's tie-breaking vote in the event of a 50-50 split. The resolution will be based on the official election results as certified by the relevant state and federal authorities. In the event of disputes or recounts, the question will resolve based on the final, certified election results. If the Democratic Party holds a majority in only one chamber, the question resolves as No.

title: Will a political figure announce a formal initiative to integrate Formula 1 racing into national economic development plans by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a current or former political figure of any country announces a formal initiative to integrate Formula 1 racing into the national economic development plans. The announcement must be made through official channels, such as a government press release, an official speech, or a documented policy proposal. The initiative must aim at leveraging Formula 1 racing for economic benefits, such as tourism promotion, technological innovation, or international branding. Confirmation from reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or the official Formula 1 website is required for resolution. In the absence of a clear announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations are sufficient. The initiative must be new and not a continuation or reiteration of existing plans. Temporary or event-specific promotions do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a new global pandemic treaty be established by the WHO with unanimous support from all member countries by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new global pandemic treaty has been established by the World Health Organization (WHO) with unanimous support from all member countries. The treaty must be officially announced by the WHO and must aim to improve pandemic prevention, preparedness, and response globally. Unanimous support means that all member countries of the WHO at the time of the treaty's establishment have formally agreed to the treaty's terms and conditions, without any objections. Confirmation of the treaty's establishment and the unanimous support must come from official WHO announcements or documentation. In the absence of direct WHO confirmation, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient. The treaty must be fully ratified and come into effect by the resolution date for this question to resolve as Yes. In the event of partial ratification or if any member country withdraws its support before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a machine learning model surpass human accuracy in diagnosing diseases by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a machine learning model is demonstrated to surpass human medical professionals in accuracy for diagnosing diseases. The model must achieve a higher accuracy rate than the current highest recorded accuracy rate of human medical professionals in at least one of the following areas: cancer detection, infectious diseases, or chronic conditions. The achievement must be validated through a study published in a peer-reviewed medical journal and recognized by a leading medical organization or authority. In cases where multiple models claim this achievement, the question will resolve as Yes for the first model to be published and recognized as meeting these criteria. The model must be operational and available for use in a clinical setting, not merely in a trial or experimental phase.

title: Will Amazon deploy an AI system capable of fully autonomous warehouse management by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Amazon has officially deployed an AI system capable of fully autonomous warehouse management across any of its warehouse facilities. A 'fully autonomous warehouse management' system is defined as an AI system that can independently handle all aspects of warehouse operations, including inventory management, order processing, packing, shipping, and receiving, without human intervention. The deployment of such a system must be confirmed by an official Amazon announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The system must be operational, not in a trial phase. In the event of a partial deployment (e.g., limited to specific warehouses or areas), the question will resolve as Yes if the system is intended for nationwide or global expansion. Temporary deployments or the use of similar technology in pilot projects do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Supreme Court of the US rule on a case involving AI-generated content's copyright by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Supreme Court of the United States has issued a ruling on a case specifically involving the copyright of AI-generated content. The case must directly address the legal status of content created by artificial intelligence, including but not limited to text, images, music, and video. The ruling must clarify whether AI-generated content is eligible for copyright protection under U.S. law. For this question to resolve as Yes, the ruling must be publicly available and verifiable through official court documents or announcements. In the absence of a direct ruling by the Supreme Court, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters) confirming the court's decision will be sufficient for resolution. This question resolves as NO if no such ruling has been made by the specified date.

title: Will a major technology company face a landmark ethics investigation by the United States government before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a major technology company (defined as a company with a market capitalization exceeding $100 billion USD at the time of the investigation's announcement) faces a landmark ethics investigation by the United States government. A "landmark ethics investigation" is defined as an investigation that is conducted by a major federal agency (e.g., Department of Justice, Federal Trade Commission) or a congressional committee and is focused on allegations of significant ethical misconduct, including but not limited to privacy violations, antitrust issues, or misuse of customer data. The investigation must be publicly announced by the investigating body or reported by at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event of multiple investigations, the question will resolve as Yes upon the announcement of the first investigation meeting these criteria. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations are sufficient. Temporary or minor investigations do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Sweden introduce a universal basic income policy before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Sweden officially introduces a universal basic income (UBI) policy that provides regular, unconditional payments to all its citizens or residents, regardless of employment status. The policy must be enacted by the Swedish government and cover the entire population of Sweden. Confirmation must come from official government announcements or legislation passed by the Swedish Parliament. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. The introduction of pilot programs, proposals, or discussions about UBI does not count towards this question's resolution. The policy must be fully implemented and operational, not in a trial or planning phase.

title: Will France implement a nationwide carbon-neutral initiative by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, France has officially implemented a nationwide initiative that is recognized as carbon-neutral. The initiative must encompass actions across multiple sectors, including but not limited to energy, transportation, industry, and agriculture, aimed at achieving a net-zero carbon footprint for the country.

The implementation of the initiative must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient.

For the purpose of this question, "carbon-neutral" refers to the balance between emitting carbon and absorbing carbon from the atmosphere in carbon sinks. Removals of carbon must be verifiable and sustainable over the long term.

In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., limited to specific regions or sectors), the question will resolve as Yes only if there is a clear, government-confirmed plan for nationwide coverage by the deadline. Temporary measures or initiatives that do not aim for or achieve nationwide coverage do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Ukraine's GDP per capita surpass that of Poland before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Ukraine's GDP per capita, as reported by the World Bank or another internationally recognized economic organization, surpasses that of Poland for any fiscal year. The GDP per capita should be calculated using current US dollars for a consistent comparison. In the event that the World Bank or equivalent authoritative source discontinues its reporting or significantly changes its methodology, the most comparable and reputable alternative source will be used. The resolution will be based on the first report published after the fiscal year in question, acknowledging that revisions may occur which could affect the outcome. In case of discrepancies between sources, the World Bank's data will take precedence.

title: Will a new infectious disease be identified that significantly impacts global health by 2025?
Will there be a significant discovery in robotics that contributes to the advancement of natural sciences by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant discovery in robotics has been made that contributes to the advancement of natural sciences. A "significant discovery" is defined as a development in robotics technology or application that leads to a breakthrough in understanding, methodology, or application in any of the natural sciences (such as Biology, Physics, Chemistry, Earth Science, or Astronomy). The discovery must be recognized as a significant contribution by the scientific community, evidenced by publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal, and coverage in at least two reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The discovery must be specifically attributed to the use or development of robotics technology. In the event of multiple discoveries, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria.

title: Will there be a groundbreaking discovery in natural sciences that influences the development of sports technologies by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a groundbreaking discovery in the natural sciences is announced that significantly influences the development of sports technologies. A "groundbreaking discovery" is defined as a scientific finding or innovation that leads to the development of new sports equipment, materials, training methods, or performance enhancement techniques that represent a significant advancement over current capabilities. The discovery must be recognized as groundbreaking by a consensus of experts in the relevant scientific field or by a major scientific organization. The influence on sports technologies must be documented by the introduction of new products, patents, or methodologies in the sports industry, as reported by reputable industry sources, scientific journals, or major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). In the event that multiple discoveries are announced, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria.

title: Will a new chemical element related to nuclear technology be discovered by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new chemical element that has applications in nuclear technology is officially discovered and recognized by the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC).

The element must be added to the periodic table and have its discovery published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal. The element's relevance to nuclear technology must be explicitly mentioned in the publication or subsequent analysis by recognized experts in the field of nuclear chemistry or physics.

In the event that multiple elements are discovered, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one of the elements meets the above criteria.

This question resolves as NO if no such element is discovered and recognized by the specified date.

title: Will Italy phase out all nuclear power plants by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Italy has officially phased out all operational nuclear power plants within its territory. Phasing out refers to the cessation of all nuclear power generation activities, including the shutdown of reactors and cessation of electricity production by nuclear means. The resolution will be based on official announcements from the Italian government or relevant regulatory bodies overseeing nuclear energy. In the absence of direct government announcements, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) will be considered sufficient evidence. Temporary shutdowns for maintenance or upgrades do not count towards this question's resolution. In the event of a decommissioning process initiated but not completed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a breakthrough in nuclear fusion technology be achieved by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a breakthrough in nuclear fusion technology is achieved and recognized by the scientific community. A "breakthrough" is defined as achieving a net energy gain from a nuclear fusion reaction that is sustainable and reproducible in a controlled environment. This includes but is not limited to: 

- The initiation of a self-sustaining nuclear fusion reaction with a net energy output that exceeds the energy input for a continuous period of at least 5 minutes. 
- The successful demonstration of a nuclear fusion reactor prototype that operates at or above break-even point, where the energy produced equals or surpasses the energy consumed, in a manner that is verifiable and reproducible. 

The breakthrough must be documented and confirmed by at least one of the following: an official announcement from a leading nuclear research institution (e.g., ITER, National Ignition Facility), publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal, or coverage by at least three reputable news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post).

title: Will machine learning algorithms surpass human accuracy in image recognition by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, machine learning algorithms have surpassed human accuracy in image recognition tasks. "Human accuracy" refers to the average accuracy rate of a group of humans (at least 100 individuals) performing the same image recognition tasks under controlled conditions. The comparison must be based on a peer-reviewed study or studies published in reputable scientific journals, which directly compare the performance of machine learning algorithms to that of humans on identical tasks. The study or studies must use a statistically significant sample size and methodology that is widely accepted in the scientific community. The resolution will be based on the consensus of findings from at least three such studies. In the event that no studies meeting these criteria are published by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the development of technology significantly influence the outcome of the 2024 US presidential election?
Will the NFL adopt AI-driven strategies for game planning and player training by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the National Football League (NFL) has officially adopted artificial intelligence-driven strategies for game planning and/or player training. Adoption must be confirmed through official NFL announcements or documentation. In the absence of direct announcements, credible reports from at least three major sports or news organizations (ESPN, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. AI-driven strategies refer to the use of artificial intelligence systems to analyze player performance, strategize game plays, or enhance player training and development. The technology must be in active use by at least one NFL team for the entire duration of a regular season to count towards this question's resolution. Temporary or trial implementations do not qualify. In the event of a partial adoption (e.g., limited to specific teams), the question will resolve as Yes if there is an intention for league-wide implementation.

title: Will North Korea announce a formal initiative to address climate change by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, North Korea has officially announced a formal initiative to address climate change. The initiative must be aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions, promoting renewable energy, or other significant environmental protection measures. The announcement must come from an official government source or be confirmed by at least three reputable international news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Guardian, Reuters). In the absence of a direct announcement, credible evidence of the initiative's implementation (e.g., legislative actions, official policy documents) reported by these sources will also lead to a Yes resolution. Initiatives that are purely rhetorical without evidence of concrete actions or plans will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Germany achieve a 50% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions from 1990 levels by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Germany has officially achieved a 50% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions from 1990 levels. The assessment must be based on official data released by the German Federal Environment Agency (Umweltbundesamt) or an equivalent authoritative body. The calculation of emissions reduction will include all sectors of the economy, including energy, industrial processes, agriculture, waste management, and land-use change and forestry. Interim reports or projections are not sufficient for resolution; only final, confirmed data will be considered. In the event that the official data for 2025 is not available by the resolution date, the question will resolve based on the most recent data available. If there is a significant revision of past emissions data that affects the calculation, the question will resolve using the revised data set.

title: Will the Amazon rainforest's rate of deforestation decrease by 30% by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the rate of deforestation in the Amazon rainforest has decreased by at least 30% compared to the average annual rate of deforestation recorded between 2020 and 2024. The assessment will be based on data and analysis provided by the National Institute for Space Research (INPE) of Brazil or any other internationally recognized environmental research organization. The calculation of the deforestation rate will consider the total area of forest cleared, as officially reported. In the event that INPE or equivalent authoritative sources do not provide clear or updated data, reputable global environmental organizations such as the World Wildlife Fund (WWF) or Greenpeace may be consulted for their published reports on the matter. In case of conflicting reports, a consensus among the mentioned sources will be sought to determine the outcome. Temporary fluctuations in deforestation rates due to natural events (e.g., wildfires) will not affect the resolution of this question.

title: Will North Korea hold a free and fair presidential election before 2040?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2040, North Korea conducts a presidential election that is widely recognized as free and fair by a majority of the following international observers: the United Nations, the European Union, and the Carter Center. A "free and fair" election is defined as one in which: - There is universal suffrage for all citizens aged 18 and over; - There are multiple independent candidates or parties; - The election process is transparent, and the results are verifiable; - There is no widespread evidence of voter intimidation, fraud, or suppression. In the absence of consensus among the specified observers, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post, Reuters) confirming the election's fairness will also be considered sufficient for resolution. Temporary or symbolic elections, or those conducted under significant foreign influence, do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a major election in a democratic country be significantly influenced by a sudden atmospheric event before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a major election in a democratic country is significantly influenced by a sudden atmospheric event. A "major election" is defined as a presidential, parliamentary, or general election at the national level. A "sudden atmospheric event" includes, but is not limited to, severe storms, hurricanes, tornadoes, blizzards, heatwaves, or significant air quality deterioration events. The influence must be substantial enough to alter the expected election outcome, delay the election process, or significantly impact voter turnout. The determination of significant influence will be based on reports from at least three reputable news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or official government statements. In the absence of clear evidence, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Supreme Court of the US make a landmark ruling that significantly affects the outcome of a presidential election before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the Supreme Court of the United States issues a ruling that directly influences the outcome of a presidential election. A ruling is considered to significantly affect the outcome if it alters the result that would have occurred without the Court's intervention, such as by changing the winner of the election, altering the distribution of electoral votes in a manner that affects the election result, or mandating a recount that leads to a different outcome. The ruling must be related to the electoral process, voter eligibility, vote counting, or any legal disputes that pertain to the presidential election. Confirmation of such a ruling must come from official court documentation. In the absence of a direct announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) are sufficient. In the event of ambiguity or multiple interpretations of the ruling's impact, the consensus among these news sources will be considered.

title: Will a new element be discovered by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new chemical element is officially recognized by the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC). The discovery must be confirmed through peer-reviewed research and meet the criteria for discovery set forth by the IUPAC, including but not limited to the observation of the element in a laboratory setting and the verification of its atomic number. The element must be added to the periodic table and receive an official name and symbol from the IUPAC. In the event of multiple discoveries, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one new element meets these criteria.

title: Will there be a significant scientific discovery that influences US environmental policy by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a significant scientific discovery is made that directly influences United States environmental policy. A "significant scientific discovery" is defined as a finding that leads to the enactment of new legislation, significant amendment of existing laws, or a major shift in policy direction at the federal level. The discovery must be related to environmental science, including but not limited to climate change, biodiversity, pollution, or renewable energy sources.

The influence on policy must be clearly attributable to the discovery, as evidenced by legislative texts, official government statements, or credible news reports from reputable sources such as BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, or Washington Post. In the absence of direct evidence, a consensus among at least three environmental policy experts, as reported in reputable media, will be sufficient to resolve the question as Yes.

In the event that multiple discoveries meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first discovery that leads to a policy change.

title: Will a major scientific breakthrough in renewable energy technologies emerge from Iran by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major scientific breakthrough in renewable energy technologies is announced and originates from Iran. A "major scientific breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or development that significantly advances the field of renewable energy, such as a new method of energy generation, storage, or efficiency improvement, which has the potential to markedly increase the sustainability or reduce the cost of renewable energy on a global scale. The breakthrough must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or receive widespread recognition from the global scientific community. Confirmation from at least two reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, Bloomberg, New York Times, Washington Post) or an official press release from a leading scientific organization is required for resolution. Developments that are only incremental improvements or lack significant impact on the global renewable energy landscape will not be considered.

title: Will the NBA invest in space-related technologies or sponsor a space mission by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the National Basketball Association (NBA) has officially invested in space-related technologies or sponsored a space mission. An investment is defined as financial contributions or partnerships directly supporting the development, research, or launch of space-related technologies or missions. Sponsorship of a space mission includes financial support, branding, or partnerships with space agencies or private space companies for a specific mission. Confirmation must come from official NBA announcements or credible news sources such as BBC, The New York Times, Reuters, or Bloomberg. In the absence of an official announcement, reports from at least three reputable news organizations are required for resolution. Investments or sponsorships announced but not executed by the resolution date do not count.

title: Will a significant discovery in space lead to a new economic model or job sector as predicted by the Bureau of Labor Statistics by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant discovery in space leads to the creation of a new economic model or job sector that is recognized and predicted by the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) in the United States.

A "significant discovery in space" refers to any discovery beyond Earth's atmosphere that fundamentally alters our understanding or utilization of space, such as the discovery of valuable minerals on an asteroid, the identification of a viable energy source, or the establishment of a permanent human settlement.

The new economic model or job sector must be explicitly mentioned in a BLS report or press release as a direct result of the space discovery. The report must detail how the discovery has created new job opportunities or economic activities that did not previously exist.

In the absence of a BLS report, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The New York Times, The Washington Post) confirming the economic impact of the discovery will also be considered sufficient for resolution.

title: Will the value of investments in space exploration exceed the market capitalization of the US dollar by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the total value of investments in space exploration exceeds the market capitalization of the US dollar. For the purpose of this question, "investments in space exploration" include all public and private funding directed towards space travel, satellite launches, space station construction, and planetary exploration. The "market capitalization of the US dollar" refers to the total value of all US dollars in circulation, as reported by the United States Federal Reserve. The assessment will be based on the most reliable financial reports and data available from authoritative sources such as the United States Federal Reserve, major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters), and leading space exploration entities (e.g., NASA, SpaceX). In the event of conflicting reports, a consensus will be sought from at least three reputable financial or space exploration news sources. The resolution will consider only officially announced and verified investments and financial figures.

title: Will a machine learning model be used to predict significant natural disasters with over 90% accuracy by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a machine learning model is used to predict significant natural disasters (including but not limited to earthquakes, hurricanes, tsunamis, and volcanic eruptions) with over 90% accuracy. The prediction model must be validated by a reputable scientific or governmental organization and have its results published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or officially announced by a governmental disaster response agency. The model must predict the location, time window of occurrence (within a 48-hour range), and magnitude of the disaster with over 90% accuracy, confirmed by post-event analysis. Predictions must be for events causing significant impact, defined as resulting in at least 100 fatalities, the displacement of over 1,000 people, or causing economic damages exceeding $100 million USD. In the event of multiple models achieving this criterion, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first verified instance. Temporary or experimental deployments do not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will a significant discovery in the field of natural sciences be named after a concept or phenomenon related to tennis by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a significant discovery in the field of natural sciences (including but not limited to physics, chemistry, biology, and earth sciences) is officially named after a concept or phenomenon directly related to the sport of tennis. Significant discovery refers to a finding that substantially advances understanding or application in its field, as recognized by a major scientific organization or publication. The naming must be officially recognized by a leading scientific body or journal and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post). The tennis-related term must be explicitly mentioned as the inspiration for the name. In the event of ambiguity regarding the significance of the discovery or the inspiration for the name, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new species of plant or animal be discovered in Virginia that significantly impacts the field of natural sciences by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new species of plant or animal is discovered in Virginia that significantly impacts the field of natural sciences. The discovery must be documented and recognized by a reputable scientific body or publication, such as the National Academy of Sciences or Nature. The impact on the natural sciences must be demonstrated through publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal, citing the discovery as a significant advancement or breakthrough in the field. The species must be native to Virginia and not previously identified by science. In the event of a dispute over the discovery's significance, a consensus among experts in the relevant field, as reported by at least three reputable scientific publications, will be required for resolution. Discoveries made by both professional scientists and citizen scientists are eligible, provided they meet the above criteria.

title: Will a major golf tournament significantly impact local economies in a measurable way by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major golf tournament (defined as one of the four major championships: The Masters, U.S. Open, The Open Championship, or the PGA Championship) has a measurable and significant impact on the local economy of the host location. Significant impact is defined as a documented increase in local business revenues, employment rates, or tourism numbers during and following the tournament period, compared to similar periods in previous years without the tournament. The impact must be confirmed by economic reports from reputable sources, such as government economic development agencies, recognized economic research institutions, or major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Financial Times). In the absence of direct economic reports, credible coverage from at least three major news organizations (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) confirming the economic impact will suffice. Temporary economic boosts solely during the tournament do not qualify unless followed by sustained economic benefits. The resolution will default to No if no such impact is documented by the specified date.

title: Will a groundbreaking study in epidemiology lead to a major shift in public health policies by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a groundbreaking study in epidemiology results in a major shift in public health policies in at least one of the G7 countries (United States, United Kingdom, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan). A "groundbreaking study" is defined as research that significantly alters the understanding of public health risks, disease transmission, prevention strategies, or treatment methodologies, and is recognized as such by the World Health Organization (WHO) or a similar authoritative body in the field of public health. A "major shift in public health policies" refers to the implementation of new policies or significant amendments to existing policies, directly attributable to the findings of the study, as reported by reputable news sources (BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) or official government publications. The shift must be substantial and represent a departure from previous guidelines or strategies.
